title: How to Save a PowerPoint Presentation on a Thumbdrive

steps.title: Make sure your thumb drive/data-stick is already in the USB port.
steps.content: Make sure your thumb drive/data-stick is already in the USB port.

steps.title: Go to File> Save As> Locate the thumb-drive/data-stick from the drop down menu.
steps.content: Go to File> Save As> Locate the thumb-drive/data-stick from the drop down menu.

steps.title: Name your presentation (if you want a different name then already given).
steps.content: Name your presentation (if you want a different name then already given).

steps.title: Click the Save button and close the PowerPoint presentation.
steps.content: Click the Save button and close the PowerPoint presentation.

steps.title: Instruct your computer to remove the hardware.
steps.content: Instruct your computer to remove the hardware. Don't just remove the data-stick/thumb-drive from the port. On the Taskbar (bottom of the monitor) you will see a small drive icon. Mouse over it and it says, "Safely Remove Hardware" on a PC or "Eject" on a Mac. Right click on it and simply locate the thumb-drive and then click "Stop." On a Mac, you can drag it to the trash can.

steps.title: Wait for the prompt to tell you that it is safe to disconnect your device.
steps.content: Wait for the prompt to tell you that it is safe to disconnect your device. That's it. You can now physically remove the device from your computer.
